text: our adoption of the cloud and our move
to AWS has had a profound effect on all
of the staff in my department whether
it's my managers or all of my staff who
support individuals we're all gaining
the techniques and the skills necessary
to embrace really what is the next
change in IT sou is a public liberal
arts college located in Ashland Oregon
we've got about 6,400 students and about
a thousand faculty and staff the biggest
challenges that we're facing of course
are resources as well as staff resources
we have students and faculty and staff
who work all over the country all over
the world and so we need to be able to
kind of meet that need all of our
courses now have some sort of online
component whether it's through a
learning management system or if they're
conducted entirely online the cloud
offers us an opportunity to be more
responsive improve our services at a
reasonable price
something that we couldn't do on our own
we need to find and we need to use a
partner in order to do that the main
factor that made us choose EWS over
other options was the low cost and the
ease to get started
we were able to create an AWS account
with a credit card and start testing
right away for our own operations we
began moving our infrastructure into the
cloud so for example we use the AWS
Storage Gateway and that was a decision
we made because of the frustration and
issues we've had with backups before we
started using AWS our backup environment
consisted of multiple applications and
we were backing up two on disk storage
and backing up to tapes which were then
parted off-site by an outside vendor
almost every month we had a problem in
one form or another either with software
with the tape library if there was a
problem with the files we were trying to
backup well that would put our entire
backup cycle back days or even weeks
with AWS we're able to write to as many
storage gateways as we want and we can
spend new storage gateways up quickly so
if we had a problem with one or had a
problem with a specific backup job we
could easily just use another storage
gateway with our old backup solution our
just recovery plan would involve getting
the tapes from our outside vendor and
bring them to campus and then
retrieving our data from the tapes and
now we know that with AWS Storage
Gateway our data is safe in Northern
Virginia and we can retrieve it from
really anywhere in the world if we
needed to we use puppet so that we can
deploy quickly applications and it
doesn't actually matter where those
applications are deployed so by adopting
that we're able to incorporate whether
it's going to be deployed in AWS or if
it's in to be deployed on premises or if
it's going to be deployed at our
secondary data center that provides a
method of consistency and redundancy and
reliability
instead of handcrafting servers giving
them you know funky names and you know
adopting and I so they were pets really
these are just commodity items and we're
just treating like the commodity that
they are a big factor in our interest in
moving forward AWS has been the kind of
customer experience we've had an expert
on AWS came out and worked with our team
to help us in a roadmap our future
services everything that we're doing is
new to us and so having that help and
support from AWS makes a big difference
we're able to better do our job serving
students to the university by focusing
on the things that really impact them
instead of spending our time worrying
about problematic backups the most
important thing that we can do here is
have an impact on the education in the
environment and experience that students
have on campus
